step1.sentence: The principal promised to look into the complaint and respond within a week.

step2.story: Strange sounds had been coming from the basement for three nights in a row. Finally, Dad grabbed a flashlight and went down to look into it. He found a family of mice that had moved in behind the water heater.

step3.story: A customer left a detailed review saying her package had arrived damaged three times in a row. The store manager decided to look into the issue personally. He traced the orders through the shipping system and discovered that a specific packaging station was using undersized boxes. The problem was fixed by the end of the week and the customer received a personal apology.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 문제나 상황을 조사하거나 파악하기 위해 살펴보다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 불만, 문제, 이상한 상황 등을 자세히 조사할 때 씁니다. investigate보다 구어체적입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: look(보다)과 into(안으로)가 결합하여 표면 아래를 들여다보며 조사한다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 공식적이거나 비공식적인 조사 모두에 쓸 수 있는 표현으로, 특히 문제 해결 맥락에서 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We are looking into the cause of the delay and will update you soon.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 지연 원인을 조사 중이며 곧 알려드리겠습니다.
